name: Update
description: This object represents an incoming update.At most one of the optional parameters can be present in any given update.

items.name: update_id
items.description: The update's unique identifier. Update identifiers start from a certain positive number and increase sequentially. This ID becomes especially handy if you're using Webhooks, since it allows you to ignore repeated updates or to restore the correct update sequence, should they get out of order. If there are no new updates for at least a week, then identifier of the next update will be chosen randomly instead of sequentially.

items.name: message
items.description: Optional. New incoming message of any kind — text, photo, sticker, etc.

items.name: edited_message
items.description: Optional. New version of a message that is known to the bot and was edited

items.name: channel_post
items.description: Optional. New incoming channel post of any kind — text, photo, sticker, etc.

items.name: edited_channel_post
items.description: Optional. New version of a channel post that is known to the bot and was edited

items.name: inline_query
items.description: Optional. New incoming inline query

items.name: chosen_inline_result
items.description: Optional. The result of an inline query that was chosen by a user and sent to their chat partner. Please see our documentation on the feedback collecting for details on how to enable these updates for your bot.

items.name: callback_query
items.description: Optional. New incoming callback query

items.name: shipping_query
items.description: Optional. New incoming shipping query. Only for invoices with flexible price

items.name: pre_checkout_query
items.description: Optional. New incoming pre-checkout query. Contains full information about checkout

items.name: poll
items.description: Optional. New poll state. Bots receive only updates about stopped polls and polls, which are sent by the bot

items.name: poll_answer
items.description: Optional. A user changed their answer in a non-anonymous poll. Bots receive new votes only in polls that were sent by the bot itself.

items.name: my_chat_member
items.description: Optional. The bot's chat member status was updated in a chat. For private chats, this update is received only when the bot is blocked or unblocked by the user.

items.name: chat_member
items.description: Optional. A chat member's status was updated in a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify “chat_member” in the list of allowed_updates to receive these updates.

items.name: chat_join_request
items.description: Optional. A request to join the chat has been sent. The bot must have the can_invite_users administrator right in the chat to receive these updates.

name: getUpdates
description: Use this method to receive incoming updates using long polling (wiki). An Array of Update objects is returned.

items.name: offset
items.description: Identifier of the first update to be returned. Must be greater by one than the highest among the identifiers of previously received updates. By default, updates starting with the earliest unconfirmed update are returned. An update is considered confirmed as soon as getUpdates is called with an offset higher than its update_id. The negative offset can be specified to retrieve updates starting from -offset update from the end of the updates queue. All previous updates will forgotten.

items.name: limit
items.description: Limits the number of updates to be retrieved. Values between 1-100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.

items.name: timeout
items.description: Timeout in seconds for long polling. Defaults to 0, i.e. usual short polling. Should be positive, short polling should be used for testing purposes only.

items.name: allowed_updates
items.description: A JSON-serialized list of the update types you want your bot to receive. For example, specify [“message”, “edited_channel_post”, “callback_query”] to only receive updates of these types. See Update for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all update types except chat_member (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the getUpdates, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

name: setWebhook
description: Use this method to specify a url and receive incoming updates via an outgoing webhook. Whenever there is an update for the bot, we will send an HTTPS POST request to the specified url, containing a JSON-serialized Update. In case of an unsuccessful request, we will give up after a reasonable amount of attempts. Returns True on success.

If you'd like to make sure that the Webhook request comes from Telegram, we recommend using a secret path in the URL, e.g. https://www.example.com/<token>. Since nobody else knows your bot's token, you can be pretty sure it's us.

items.name: url
items.description: HTTPS url to send updates to. Use an empty string to remove webhook integration

items.name: certificate
items.description: Upload your public key certificate so that the root certificate in use can be checked. See our self-signed guide for details.

items.name: ip_address
items.description: The fixed IP address which will be used to send webhook requests instead of the IP address resolved through DNS

items.name: max_connections
items.description: Maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery, 1-100. Defaults to 40. Use lower values to limit the load on your bot's server, and higher values to increase your bot's throughput.

items.name: allowed_updates
items.description: A JSON-serialized list of the update types you want your bot to receive. For example, specify [“message”, “edited_channel_post”, “callback_query”] to only receive updates of these types. See Update for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all update types except chat_member (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the setWebhook, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

items.name: drop_pending_updates
items.description: Pass True to drop all pending updates

name: deleteWebhook
description: Use this method to remove webhook integration if you decide to switch back to getUpdates. Returns True on success.

items.name: drop_pending_updates
items.description: Pass True to drop all pending updates

name: getWebhookInfo
description: Use this method to get current webhook status. Requires no parameters. On success, returns a WebhookInfo object. If the bot is using getUpdates, will return an object with the url field empty.

name: WebhookInfo
description: Contains information about the current status of a webhook.
All types used in the Bot API responses are represented as JSON-objects.
It is safe to use 32-bit signed integers for storing all Integer fields unless otherwise noted.

items.name: url
items.description: Webhook URL, may be empty if webhook is not set up

items.name: has_custom_certificate
items.description: True, if a custom certificate was provided for webhook certificate checks

items.name: pending_update_count
items.description: Number of updates awaiting delivery

items.name: ip_address
items.description: Optional. Currently used webhook IP address

items.name: last_error_date
items.description: Optional. Unix time for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

items.name: last_error_message
items.description: Optional. Error message in human-readable format for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

items.name: last_synchronization_error_date
items.description: Optional. Unix time of the most recent error that happened when trying to synchronize available updates with Telegram datacenters

items.name: max_connections
items.description: Optional. Maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery

items.name: allowed_updates
items.description: Optional. A list of update types the bot is subscribed to. Defaults to all update types except chat_member

name: User
description: This object represents a Telegram user or bot.

items.name: id
items.description: Unique identifier for this user or bot. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

items.name: is_bot
items.description: True, if this user is a bot

items.name: first_name
items.description: User's or bot's first name

items.name: last_name
items.description: Optional. User's or bot's last name

items.name: username
items.description: Optional. User's or bot's username

items.name: language_code
items.description: Optional. IETF language tag of the user's language

items.name: can_join_groups
items.description: Optional. True, if the bot can be invited to groups. Returned only in getMe.

items.name: can_read_all_group_messages
items.description: Optional. True, if privacy mode is disabled for the bot. Returned only in getMe.

items.name: supports_inline_queries
items.description: Optional. True, if the bot supports inline queries. Returned only in getMe.

name: Chat
description: This object represents a chat.

items.name: id
items.description: Unique identifier for this chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

items.name: type
items.description: Type of chat, can be either “private”, “group”, “supergroup” or “channel”

items.name: title
items.description: Optional. Title, for supergroups, channels and group chats

items.name: username
items.description: Optional. Username, for private chats, supergroups and channels if available

items.name: first_name
items.description: Optional. First name of the other party in a private chat

items.name: last_name
items.description: Optional. Last name of the other party in a private chat

items.name: photo
items.description: Optional. Chat photo. Returned only in getChat.

items.name: bio
items.description: Optional. Bio of the other party in a private chat. Returned only in getChat.

items.name: has_private_forwards
items.description: Optional. True, if privacy settings of the other party in the private chat allows to use tg://user?id=<user_id> links only in chats with the user. Returned only in getChat.

items.name: description
items.description: Optional. Description, for groups, supergroups and channel chats. Returned only in getChat.

items.name: invite_link
items.description: Optional. Primary invite link, for groups, supergroups and channel chats. Returned only in getChat.

items.name: pinned_message
items.description: Optional. The most recent pinned message (by sending date). Returned only in getChat.

items.name: permissions
items.description: Optional. Default chat member permissions, for groups and supergroups. Returned only in getChat.

items.name: slow_mode_delay
items.description: Optional. For supergroups, the minimum allowed delay between consecutive messages sent by each unpriviledged user; in seconds. Returned only in getChat.

items.name: message_auto_delete_time
items.description: Optional. The time after which all messages sent to the chat will be automatically deleted; in seconds. Returned only in getChat.

items.name: has_protected_content
items.description: Optional. True, if messages from the chat can't be forwarded to other chats. Returned only in getChat.

items.name: sticker_set_name
items.description: Optional. For supergroups, name of group sticker set. Returned only in getChat.

items.name: can_set_sticker_set
items.description: Optional. True, if the bot can change the group sticker set. Returned only in getChat.

items.name: linked_chat_id
items.description: Optional. Unique identifier for the linked chat, i.e. the discussion group identifier for a channel and vice versa; for supergroups and channel chats. This identifier may be greater than 32 bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it is smaller than 52 bits, so a signed 64 bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. Returned only in getChat.

items.name: location
items.description: Optional. For supergroups, the location to which the supergroup is connected. Returned only in getChat.

name: Message
description: This object represents a message.

items.name: message_id
items.description: Unique message identifier inside this chat

items.name: from
items.description: Optional. Sender of the message; empty for messages sent to channels. For backward compatibility, the field contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.

items.name: sender_chat
items.description: Optional. Sender of the message, sent on behalf of a chat. For example, the channel itself for channel posts, the supergroup itself for messages from anonymous group administrators, the linked channel for messages automatically forwarded to the discussion group.  For backward compatibility, the field from contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.

items.name: date
items.description: Date the message was sent in Unix time

items.name: chat
items.description: Conversation the message belongs to

items.name: forward_from
items.description: Optional. For forwarded messages, sender of the original message

items.name: forward_from_chat
items.description: Optional. For messages forwarded from channels or from anonymous administrators, information about the original sender chat

items.name: forward_from_message_id
items.description: Optional. For messages forwarded from channels, identifier of the original message in the channel

items.name: forward_signature
items.description: Optional. For forwarded messages that were originally sent in channels or by an anonymous chat administrator, signature of the message sender if present

items.name: forward_sender_name
items.description: Optional. Sender's name for messages forwarded from users who disallow adding a link to their account in forwarded messages

items.name: forward_date
items.description: Optional. For forwarded messages, date the original message was sent in Unix time

items.name: is_automatic_forward
items.description: Optional. True, if the message is a channel post that was automatically forwarded to the connected discussion group

items.name: reply_to_message
items.description: Optional. For replies, the original message. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it itself is a reply.

items.name: via_bot
items.description: Optional. Bot through which the message was sent

items.name: edit_date
items.description: Optional. Date the message was last edited in Unix time

items.name: has_protected_content
items.description: Optional. True, if the message can't be forwarded

items.name: media_group_id
items.description: Optional. The unique identifier of a media message group this message belongs to

items.name: author_signature
items.description: Optional. Signature of the post author for messages in channels, or the custom title of an anonymous group administrator

items.name: text
items.description: Optional. For text messages, the actual UTF-8 text of the message, 0-4096 characters

items.name: entities
items.description: Optional. For text messages, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the text

items.name: animation
items.description: Optional. Message is an animation, information about the animation. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the document field will also be set

items.name: audio
items.description: Optional. Message is an audio file, information about the file

items.name: document
items.description: Optional. Message is a general file, information about the file

items.name: photo
items.description: Optional. Message is a photo, available sizes of the photo

items.name: sticker
items.description: Optional. Message is a sticker, information about the sticker

items.name: video
items.description: Optional. Message is a video, information about the video

items.name: video_note
items.description: Optional. Message is a video note, information about the video message

items.name: voice
items.description: Optional. Message is a voice message, information about the file

items.name: caption
items.description: Optional. Caption for the animation, audio, document, photo, video or voice, 0-1024 characters

items.name: caption_entities
items.description: Optional. For messages with a caption, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the caption

items.name: contact
items.description: Optional. Message is a shared contact, information about the contact

items.name: dice
items.description: Optional. Message is a dice with random value

items.name: game
items.description: Optional. Message is a game, information about the game. More about games »

items.name: poll
items.description: Optional. Message is a native poll, information about the poll

items.name: venue
items.description: Optional. Message is a venue, information about the venue. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the location field will also be set

items.name: location
items.description: Optional. Message is a shared location, information about the location

items.name: new_chat_members
items.description: Optional. New members that were added to the group or supergroup and information about them (the bot itself may be one of these members)

items.name: left_chat_member
items.description: Optional. A member was removed from the group, information about them (this member may be the bot itself)

items.name: new_chat_title
items.description: Optional. A chat title was changed to this value

items.name: new_chat_photo
items.description: Optional. A chat photo was change to this value

items.name: delete_chat_photo
items.description: Optional. Service message: the chat photo was deleted

items.name: group_chat_created
items.description: Optional. Service message: the group has been created

items.name: supergroup_chat_created
items.description: Optional. Service message: the supergroup has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a supergroup when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a directly created supergroup.

items.name: channel_chat_created
items.description: Optional. Service message: the channel has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a channel when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a channel.

items.name: message_auto_delete_timer_changed
items.description: Optional. Service message: auto-delete timer settings changed in the chat

items.name: migrate_to_chat_id
items.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

items.name: migrate_from_chat_id
items.description: Optional. The supergroup has been migrated from a group with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

items.name: pinned_message
items.description: Optional. Specified message was pinned. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it is itself a reply.

items.name: invoice
items.description: Optional. Message is an invoice for a payment, information about the invoice. More about payments »

items.name: successful_payment
items.description: Optional. Message is a service message about a successful payment, information about the payment. More about payments »

items.name: connected_website
items.description: Optional. The domain name of the website on which the user has logged in. More about Telegram Login »

items.name: passport_data
items.description: Optional. Telegram Passport data

items.name: proximity_alert_triggered
items.description: Optional. Service message. A user in the chat triggered another user's proximity alert while sharing Live Location.

items.name: video_chat_scheduled
items.description: Optional. Service message: video chat scheduled

items.name: video_chat_started
items.description: Optional. Service message: video chat started

items.name: video_chat_ended
items.description: Optional. Service message: video chat ended

items.name: video_chat_participants_invited
items.description: Optional. Service message: new participants invited to a video chat

items.name: web_app_data
items.description: Optional. Service message: data sent by a Web App

items.name: reply_markup
items.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message. login_url buttons are represented as ordinary url buttons.

name: MessageId
description: This object represents a unique message identifier.

items.name: message_id
items.description: Unique message identifier

name: MessageEntity
description: This object represents one special entity in a text message. For example, hashtags, usernames, URLs, etc.

items.name: type
items.description: Type of the entity. Currently, can be “mention” (@username), “hashtag” (#hashtag), “cashtag” ($USD), “bot_command” (/start@jobs_bot), “url” (https://telegram.org), “email” (do-not-reply@telegram.org), “phone_number” (+1-212-555-0123), “bold” (bold text), “italic” (italic text), “underline” (underlined text), “strikethrough” (strikethrough text), “spoiler” (spoiler message), “code” (monowidth string), “pre” (monowidth block), “text_link” (for clickable text URLs), “text_mention” (for users without usernames)

items.name: offset
items.description: Offset in UTF-16 code units to the start of the entity

items.name: length
items.description: Length of the entity in UTF-16 code units

items.name: url
items.description: Optional. For “text_link” only, url that will be opened after user taps on the text

items.name: user
items.description: Optional. For “text_mention” only, the mentioned user

items.name: language
items.description: Optional. For “pre” only, the programming language of the entity text

name: PhotoSize
description: This object represents one size of a photo or a file / sticker thumbnail.

items.name: file_id
items.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

items.name: file_unique_id
items.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

items.name: width
items.description: Photo width

items.name: height
items.description: Photo height

items.name: file_size
items.description: Optional. File size in bytes

name: Animation
description: This object represents an animation file (GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound).

items.name: file_id
items.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

items.name: file_unique_id
items.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

items.name: width
items.description: Video width as defined by sender

items.name: height
items.description: Video height as defined by sender

items.name: duration
items.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

items.name: thumb
items.description: Optional. Animation thumbnail as defined by sender

items.name: file_name
items.description: Optional. Original animation filename as defined by sender

items.name: mime_type
items.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

items.name: file_size
items.description: Optional. File size in bytes

name: Audio
description: This object represents an audio file to be treated as music by the Telegram clients.

items.name: file_id
items.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

items.name: file_unique_id
items.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

items.name: duration
items.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by sender

items.name: performer
items.description: Optional. Performer of the audio as defined by sender or by audio tags

items.name: title
items.description: Optional. Title of the audio as defined by sender or by audio tags

items.name: file_name
items.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by sender

items.name: mime_type
items.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

items.name: file_size
items.description: Optional. File size in bytes

items.name: thumb
items.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the album cover to which the music file belongs

name: Document
description: This object represents a general file (as opposed to photos, voice messages and audio files).

items.name: file_id
items.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

items.name: file_unique_id
items.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

items.name: thumb
items.description: Optional. Document thumbnail as defined by sender

items.name: file_name
items.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by sender

items.name: mime_type
items.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

items.name: file_size
items.description: Optional. File size in bytes

name: Video
description: This object represents a video file.

items.name: file_id
items.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

items.name: file_unique_id
items.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

items.name: width
items.description: Video width as defined by sender

items.name: height
items.description: Video height as defined by sender

items.name: duration
items.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

items.name: thumb
items.description: Optional. Video thumbnail

items.name: file_name
items.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by sender

items.name: mime_type
items.description: Optional. Mime type of a file as defined by sender

items.name: file_size
items.description: Optional. File size in bytes

name: VideoNote
description: This object represents a video message (available in Telegram apps as of v.4.0).

items.name: file_id
items.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

items.name: file_unique_id
items.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

items.name: length
items.description: Video width and height (diameter of the video message) as defined by sender

items.name: duration
items.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

items.name: thumb
items.description: Optional. Video thumbnail

items.name: file_size
items.description: Optional. File size in bytes

name: Voice
description: This object represents a voice note.

items.name: file_id
items.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

items.name: file_unique_id
items.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

items.name: duration
items.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by sender

items.name: mime_type
items.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

items.name: file_size
items.description: Optional. File size in bytes

name: Contact
description: This object represents a phone contact.

items.name: phone_number
items.description: Contact's phone number

items.name: first_name
items.description: Contact's first name

items.name: last_name
items.description: Optional. Contact's last name

items.name: user_id
items.description: Optional. Contact's user identifier in Telegram. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

items.name: vcard
items.description: Optional. Additional data about the contact in the form of a vCard

name: Dice
description: This object represents an animated emoji that displays a random value.

items.name: emoji
items.description: Emoji on which the dice throw animation is based

items.name: value
items.description: Value of the dice, 1-6 for “”, “” and “” base emoji, 1-5 for “” and “” base emoji, 1-64 for “” base emoji

name: PollOption
description: This object contains information about one answer option in a poll.

items.name: text
items.description: Option text, 1-100 characters

items.name: voter_count
items.description: Number of users that voted for this option

name: PollAnswer
description: This object represents an answer of a user in a non-anonymous poll.

items.name: poll_id
items.description: Unique poll identifier

items.name: user
items.description: The user, who changed the answer to the poll

items.name: option_ids
items.description: 0-based identifiers of answer options, chosen by the user. May be empty if the user retracted their vote.

name: Poll
description: This object contains information about a poll.

items.name: id
items.description: Unique poll identifier

items.name: question
items.description: Poll question, 1-300 characters

items.name: options
items.description: List of poll options

items.name: total_voter_count
items.description: Total number of users that voted in the poll

items.name: is_closed
items.description: True, if the poll is closed

items.name: is_anonymous
items.description: True, if the poll is anonymous

items.name: type
items.description: Poll type, currently can be “regular” or “quiz”

items.name: allows_multiple_answers
items.description: True, if the poll allows multiple answers

items.name: correct_option_id
items.description: Optional. 0-based identifier of the correct answer option. Available only for polls in the quiz mode, which are closed, or was sent (not forwarded) by the bot or to the private chat with the bot.

items.name: explanation
items.description: Optional. Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters

items.name: explanation_entities
items.description: Optional. Special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the explanation

items.name: open_period
items.description: Optional. Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation

items.name: close_date
items.description: Optional. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed

name: Location
description: This object represents a point on the map.

items.name: longitude
items.description: Longitude as defined by sender

items.name: latitude
items.description: Latitude as defined by sender

items.name: horizontal_accuracy
items.description: Optional. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

items.name: live_period
items.description: Optional. Time relative to the message sending date, during which the location can be updated; in seconds. For active live locations only.

items.name: heading
items.description: Optional. The direction in which user is moving, in degrees; 1-360. For active live locations only.

items.name: proximity_alert_radius
items.description: Optional. Maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. For sent live locations only.

name: Venue
description: This object represents a venue.

items.name: location
items.description: Venue location. Can't be a live location

items.name: title
items.description: Name of the venue

items.name: address
items.description: Address of the venue

items.name: foursquare_id
items.description: Optional. Foursquare identifier of the venue

items.name: foursquare_type
items.description: Optional. Foursquare type of the venue. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

items.name: google_place_id
items.description: Optional. Google Places identifier of the venue

items.name: google_place_type
items.description: Optional. Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)

name: WebAppData
description: Contains data sent from a Web App to the bot.

items.name: data
items.description: The data. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

items.name: button_text
items.description: Text of the web_app keyboard button, from which the Web App was opened. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

name: ProximityAlertTriggered
description: This object represents the content of a service message, sent whenever a user in the chat triggers a proximity alert set by another user.

items.name: traveler
items.description: User that triggered the alert

items.name: watcher
items.description: User that set the alert

items.name: distance
items.description: The distance between the users

name: MessageAutoDeleteTimerChanged
description: This object represents a service message about a change in auto-delete timer settings.

items.name: message_auto_delete_time
items.description: New auto-delete time for messages in the chat; in seconds

name: VideoChatScheduled
description: This object represents a service message about a video chat scheduled in the chat.

items.name: start_date
items.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the video chat is supposed to be started by a chat administrator

name: VideoChatStarted
description: This object represents a service message about a video chat started in the chat. Currently holds no information.

name: VideoChatEnded
description: This object represents a service message about a video chat ended in the chat.

items.name: duration
items.description: Video chat duration in seconds

name: VideoChatParticipantsInvited
description: This object represents a service message about new members invited to a video chat.

items.name: users
items.description: New members that were invited to the video chat

name: UserProfilePhotos
description: This object represent a user's profile pictures.

items.name: total_count
items.description: Total number of profile pictures the target user has

items.name: photos
items.description: Requested profile pictures (in up to 4 sizes each)

name: File
description: This object represents a file ready to be downloaded. The file can be downloaded via the link https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>. It is guaranteed that the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link expires, a new one can be requested by calling getFile.

items.name: file_id
items.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

items.name: file_unique_id
items.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

items.name: file_size
items.description: Optional. File size in bytes, if known

items.name: file_path
items.description: Optional. File path. Use https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path> to get the file.

name: WebAppInfo
description: Contains information about a Web App.

items.name: url
items.description: An HTTPS URL of a Web App to be opened with additional data as specified in Initializing Web Apps

name: ReplyKeyboardMarkup
description: This object represents a custom keyboard with reply options (see Introduction to bots for details and examples).

items.name: keyboard
items.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of KeyboardButton objects

items.name: resize_keyboard
items.description: Optional. Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.

items.name: one_time_keyboard
items.description: Optional. Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat – the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again. Defaults to false.

items.name: input_field_placeholder
items.description: Optional. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the keyboard is active; 1-64 characters

items.name: selective
items.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.Example: A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.

name: KeyboardButton
description: This object represents one button of the reply keyboard. For simple text buttons String can be used instead of this object to specify text of the button. Optional fields web_app, request_contact, request_location, and request_poll are mutually exclusive.

Note: request_contact and request_location options will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will display unsupported message.Note: request_poll option will only work in Telegram versions released after 23 January, 2020. Older clients will display unsupported message.Note: web_app option will only work in Telegram versions released after 16 April, 2022. Older clients will display unsupported message.

items.name: text
items.description: Text of the button. If none of the optional fields are used, it will be sent as a message when the button is pressed

items.name: request_contact
items.description: Optional. If True, the user's phone number will be sent as a contact when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

items.name: request_location
items.description: Optional. If True, the user's current location will be sent when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

items.name: request_poll
items.description: Optional. If specified, the user will be asked to create a poll and send it to the bot when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

items.name: web_app
items.description: Optional. If specified, the described Web App will be launched when the button is pressed. The Web App will be able to send a “web_app_data” service message. Available in private chats only.

name: KeyboardButtonPollType
description: This object represents type of a poll, which is allowed to be created and sent when the corresponding button is pressed.

items.name: type
items.description: Optional. If quiz is passed, the user will be allowed to create only polls in the quiz mode. If regular is passed, only regular polls will be allowed. Otherwise, the user will be allowed to create a poll of any type.

name: ReplyKeyboardRemove
description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will remove the current custom keyboard and display the default letter-keyboard. By default, custom keyboards are displayed until a new keyboard is sent by a bot. An exception is made for one-time keyboards that are hidden immediately after the user presses a button (see ReplyKeyboardMarkup).

items.name: remove_keyboard
items.description: Requests clients to remove the custom keyboard (user will not be able to summon this keyboard; if you want to hide the keyboard from sight but keep it accessible, use one_time_keyboard in ReplyKeyboardMarkup)

items.name: selective
items.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to remove the keyboard for specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.Example: A user votes in a poll, bot returns confirmation message in reply to the vote and removes the keyboard for that user, while still showing the keyboard with poll options to users who haven't voted yet.

name: InlineKeyboardMarkup
description: This object represents an inline keyboard that appears right next to the message it belongs to.
Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will display unsupported message.

items.name: inline_keyboard
items.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of InlineKeyboardButton objects

name: InlineKeyboardButton
description: This object represents one button of an inline keyboard. You must use exactly one of the optional fields.

items.name: text
items.description: Label text on the button

items.name: url
items.description: Optional. HTTP or tg:// url to be opened when the button is pressed. Links tg://user?id=<user_id> can be used to mention a user by their ID without using a username, if this is allowed by their privacy settings.

items.name: callback_data
items.description: Optional. Data to be sent in a callback query to the bot when button is pressed, 1-64 bytes

items.name: web_app
items.description: Optional. Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method answerWebAppQuery. Available only in private chats between a user and the bot.

items.name: login_url
items.description: Optional. An HTTP URL used to automatically authorize the user. Can be used as a replacement for the Telegram Login Widget.

items.name: switch_inline_query
items.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field. Can be empty, in which case just the bot's username will be inserted.Note: This offers an easy way for users to start using your bot in inline mode when they are currently in a private chat with it. Especially useful when combined with switch_pm… actions – in this case the user will be automatically returned to the chat they switched from, skipping the chat selection screen.

items.name: switch_inline_query_current_chat
items.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the current chat's input field. Can be empty, in which case only the bot's username will be inserted.This offers a quick way for the user to open your bot in inline mode in the same chat – good for selecting something from multiple options.

items.name: callback_game
items.description: Optional. Description of the game that will be launched when the user presses the button.NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row.

items.name: pay
items.description: Optional. Specify True, to send a Pay button.NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row and can only be used in invoice messages.

name: LoginUrl
description: This object represents a parameter of the inline keyboard button used to automatically authorize a user. Serves as a great replacement for the Telegram Login Widget when the user is coming from Telegram. All the user needs to do is tap/click a button and confirm that they want to log in:
Telegram apps support these buttons as of version 5.7.

items.name: url
items.description: An HTTP URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in Receiving authorization data.NOTE: You must always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in Checking authorization.

items.name: forward_text
items.description: Optional. New text of the button in forwarded messages.

items.name: bot_username
items.description: Optional. Username of a bot, which will be used for user authorization. See Setting up a bot for more details. If not specified, the current bot's username will be assumed. The url's domain must be the same as the domain linked with the bot. See Linking your domain to the bot for more details.

items.name: request_write_access
items.description: Optional. Pass True to request the permission for your bot to send messages to the user.

name: CallbackQuery
description: This object represents an incoming callback query from a callback button in an inline keyboard. If the button that originated the query was attached to a message sent by the bot, the field message will be present. If the button was attached to a message sent via the bot (in inline mode), the field inline_message_id will be present. Exactly one of the fields data or game_short_name will be present.

items.name: id
items.description: Unique identifier for this query

items.name: from
items.description: Sender

items.name: message
items.description: Optional. Message with the callback button that originated the query. Note that message content and message date will not be available if the message is too old

items.name: inline_message_id
items.description: Optional. Identifier of the message sent via the bot in inline mode, that originated the query.

items.name: chat_instance
items.description: Global identifier, uniquely corresponding to the chat to which the message with the callback button was sent. Useful for high scores in games.

items.name: data
items.description: Optional. Data associated with the callback button. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

items.name: game_short_name
items.description: Optional. Short name of a Game to be returned, serves as the unique identifier for the game

name: ForceReply
description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will display a reply interface to the user (act as if the user has selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'). This can be extremely useful if you want to create user-friendly step-by-step interfaces without having to sacrifice privacy mode.

items.name: force_reply
items.description: Shows reply interface to the user, as if they manually selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'

items.name: input_field_placeholder
items.description: Optional. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the reply is active; 1-64 characters

items.name: selective
items.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to force reply from specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

name: ChatPhoto
description: This object represents a chat photo.

items.name: small_file_id
items.description: File identifier of small (160x160) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

items.name: small_file_unique_id
items.description: Unique file identifier of small (160x160) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

items.name: big_file_id
items.description: File identifier of big (640x640) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

items.name: big_file_unique_id
items.description: Unique file identifier of big (640x640) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

name: ChatInviteLink
description: Represents an invite link for a chat.

items.name: invite_link
items.description: The invite link. If the link was created by another chat administrator, then the second part of the link will be replaced with “…”.

items.name: creator
items.description: Creator of the link

items.name: creates_join_request
items.description: True, if users joining the chat via the link need to be approved by chat administrators

items.name: is_primary
items.description: True, if the link is primary

items.name: is_revoked
items.description: True, if the link is revoked

items.name: name
items.description: Optional. Invite link name

items.name: expire_date
items.description: Optional. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire or has been expired

items.name: member_limit
items.description: Optional. Maximum number of users that can be members of the chat simultaneously after joining the chat via this invite link; 1-99999

items.name: pending_join_request_count
items.description: Optional. Number of pending join requests created using this link

name: ChatAdministratorRights
description: Represents the rights of an administrator in a chat.

items.name: is_anonymous
items.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

items.name: can_manage_chat
items.description: True, if the administrator can access the chat event log, chat statistics, message statistics in channels, see channel members, see anonymous administrators in supergroups and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege

items.name: can_delete_messages
items.description: True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

items.name: can_manage_video_chats
items.description: True, if the administrator can manage video chats

items.name: can_restrict_members
items.description: True, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members

items.name: can_promote_members
items.description: True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that he has promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)

items.name: can_change_info
items.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

items.name: can_invite_users
items.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

items.name: can_post_messages
items.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can post in the channel; channels only

items.name: can_edit_messages
items.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; channels only

items.name: can_pin_messages
items.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages; groups and supergroups only

name: ChatMember
description: This object contains information about one member of a chat. Currently, the following 6 types of chat members are supported:

name: ChatMemberOwner
description: Represents a chat member that owns the chat and has all administrator privileges.

items.name: status
items.description: The member's status in the chat, always “creator”

items.name: user
items.description: Information about the user

items.name: is_anonymous
items.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

items.name: custom_title
items.description: Optional. Custom title for this user

name: ChatMemberAdministrator
description: Represents a chat member that has some additional privileges.

items.name: status
items.description: The member's status in the chat, always “administrator”

items.name: user
items.description: Information about the user

items.name: can_be_edited
items.description: True, if the bot is allowed to edit administrator privileges of that user

items.name: is_anonymous
items.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

items.name: can_manage_chat
items.description: True, if the administrator can access the chat event log, chat statistics, message statistics in channels, see channel members, see anonymous administrators in supergroups and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege

items.name: can_delete_messages
items.description: True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

items.name: can_manage_video_chats
items.description: True, if the administrator can manage video chats

items.name: can_restrict_members
items.description: True, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members

items.name: can_promote_members
items.description: True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that he has promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)

items.name: can_change_info
items.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

items.name: can_invite_users
items.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

items.name: can_post_messages
items.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can post in the channel; channels only

items.name: can_edit_messages
items.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; channels only

items.name: can_pin_messages
items.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages; groups and supergroups only

items.name: custom_title
items.description: Optional. Custom title for this user

name: ChatMemberMember
description: Represents a chat member that has no additional privileges or restrictions.

items.name: status
items.description: The member's status in the chat, always “member”

items.name: user
items.description: Information about the user

name: ChatMemberRestricted
description: Represents a chat member that is under certain restrictions in the chat. Supergroups only.

items.name: status
items.description: The member's status in the chat, always “restricted”

items.name: user
items.description: Information about the user

items.name: is_member
items.description: True, if the user is a member of the chat at the moment of the request

items.name: can_change_info
items.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

items.name: can_invite_users
items.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

items.name: can_pin_messages
items.description: True, if the user is allowed to pin messages

items.name: can_send_messages
items.description: True, if the user is allowed to send text messages, contacts, locations and venues

items.name: can_send_media_messages
items.description: True, if the user is allowed to send audios, documents, photos, videos, video notes and voice notes

items.name: can_send_polls
items.description: True, if the user is allowed to send polls

items.name: can_send_other_messages
items.description: True, if the user is allowed to send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots

items.name: can_add_web_page_previews
items.description: True, if the user is allowed to add web page previews to their messages

items.name: until_date
items.description: Date when restrictions will be lifted for this user; unix time. If 0, then the user is restricted forever

name: ChatMemberLeft
description: Represents a chat member that isn't currently a member of the chat, but may join it themselves.

items.name: status
items.description: The member's status in the chat, always “left”

items.name: user
items.description: Information about the user

name: ChatMemberBanned
description: Represents a chat member that was banned in the chat and can't return to the chat or view chat messages.

items.name: status
items.description: The member's status in the chat, always “kicked”

items.name: user
items.description: Information about the user

items.name: until_date
items.description: Date when restrictions will be lifted for this user; unix time. If 0, then the user is banned forever

name: ChatMemberUpdated
description: This object represents changes in the status of a chat member.

items.name: chat
items.description: Chat the user belongs to

items.name: from
items.description: Performer of the action, which resulted in the change

items.name: date
items.description: Date the change was done in Unix time

items.name: old_chat_member
items.description: Previous information about the chat member

items.name: new_chat_member
items.description: New information about the chat member

items.name: invite_link
items.description: Optional. Chat invite link, which was used by the user to join the chat; for joining by invite link events only.

name: ChatJoinRequest
description: Represents a join request sent to a chat.

items.name: chat
items.description: Chat to which the request was sent

items.name: from
items.description: User that sent the join request

items.name: date
items.description: Date the request was sent in Unix time

items.name: bio
items.description: Optional. Bio of the user.

items.name: invite_link
items.description: Optional. Chat invite link that was used by the user to send the join request

name: ChatPermissions
description: Describes actions that a non-administrator user is allowed to take in a chat.

items.name: can_send_messages
items.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send text messages, contacts, locations and venues

items.name: can_send_media_messages
items.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send audios, documents, photos, videos, video notes and voice notes, implies can_send_messages

items.name: can_send_polls
items.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send polls, implies can_send_messages

items.name: can_send_other_messages
items.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots, implies can_send_media_messages

items.name: can_add_web_page_previews
items.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to add web page previews to their messages, implies can_send_media_messages

items.name: can_change_info
items.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings. Ignored in public supergroups

items.name: can_invite_users
items.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

items.name: can_pin_messages
items.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages. Ignored in public supergroups

name: ChatLocation
description: Represents a location to which a chat is connected.

items.name: location
items.description: The location to which the supergroup is connected. Can't be a live location.

items.name: address
items.description: Location address; 1-64 characters, as defined by the chat owner

name: BotCommand
description: This object represents a bot command.

items.name: command
items.description: Text of the command; 1-32 characters. Can contain only lowercase English letters, digits and underscores.

items.name: description
items.description: Description of the command; 1-256 characters.

name: BotCommandScope
description: This object represents the scope to which bot commands are applied. Currently, the following 7 scopes are supported:
The following algorithm is used to determine the list of commands for a particular user viewing the bot menu. The first list of commands which is set is returned:
Commands in the chat with the bot
Commands in group and supergroup chats

name: BotCommandScopeDefault
description: Represents the default scope of bot commands. Default commands are used if no commands with a narrower scope are specified for the user.

items.name: type
items.description: Scope type, must be default

name: BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats
description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all private chats.

items.name: type
items.description: Scope type, must be all_private_chats

name: BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats
description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chats.

items.name: type
items.description: Scope type, must be all_group_chats

name: BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators
description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chat administrators.

items.name: type
items.description: Scope type, must be all_chat_administrators

name: BotCommandScopeChat
description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering a specific chat.

items.name: type
items.description: Scope type, must be chat

items.name: chat_id
items.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

name: BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators
description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all administrators of a specific group or supergroup chat.

items.name: type
items.description: Scope type, must be chat_administrators

items.name: chat_id
items.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

name: BotCommandScopeChatMember
description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering a specific member of a group or supergroup chat.

items.name: type
items.description: Scope type, must be chat_member

items.name: chat_id
items.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

items.name: user_id
items.description: Unique identifier of the target user

name: MenuButton
description: This object describes the bot's menu button in a private chat. It should be one of

If a menu button other than MenuButtonDefault is set for a private chat, then it is applied in the chat. Otherwise the default menu button is applied. By default, the menu button opens the list of bot commands.

name: MenuButtonCommands
description: Represents a menu button, which opens the bot's list of commands.

items.name: type
items.description: Type of the button, must be commands

name: MenuButtonWebApp
description: Represents a menu button, which launches a Web App.

items.name: type
items.description: Type of the button, must be web_app

items.name: text
items.description: Text on the button

items.name: web_app
items.description: Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method answerWebAppQuery.

name: MenuButtonDefault
description: Describes that no specific value for the menu button was set.

items.name: type
items.description: Type of the button, must be default

name: ResponseParameters
description: Contains information about why a request was unsuccessful.

items.name: migrate_to_chat_id
items.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

items.name: retry_after
items.description: Optional. In case of exceeding flood control, the number of seconds left to wait before the request can be repeated

name: InputMedia
description: This object represents the content of a media message to be sent. It should be one of

name: InputMediaPhoto
description: Represents a photo to be sent.

items.name: type
items.description: Type of the result, must be photo

items.name: media
items.description: File to send. name: InputFile
description: This object represents the contents of a file to be uploaded. Must be posted using multipart/form-data in the usual way that files are uploaded via the browser.
There are three ways to send files (photos, stickers, audio, media, etc.):
Sending by file_id
Sending by URL
Objects and methods used in the inline mode are described in the Inline mode section.

name: getMe
description: A simple method for testing your bot's authentication token. Requires no parameters. Returns basic information about the bot in form of a User object.

name: logOut
description: Use this method to log out from the cloud Bot API server before launching the bot locally. You must log out the bot before running it locally, otherwise there is no guarantee that the bot will receive updates. After a successful call, you can immediately log in on a local server, but will not be able to log in back to the cloud Bot API server for 10 minutes. Returns True on success. Requires no parameters.

name: close
description: Use this method to close the bot instance before moving it from one local server to another. You need to delete the webhook before calling this method to ensure that the bot isn't launched again after server restart. The method will return error 429 in the first 10 minutes after the bot is launched. Returns True on success. Requires no parameters.

name: sendMessage
description: Use this method to send text messages. On success, the sent Message is returned.

The Bot API supports basic formatting for messages. You can use bold, italic, underlined, strikethrough, and spoiler text, as well as inline links and pre-formatted code in your bots' messages. Telegram clients will render them accordingly. You can use either markdown-style or HTML-style formatting.
Note that Telegram clients will display an alert to the user before opening an inline link ('Open this link?' together with the full URL).

Message entities can be nested, providing following restrictions are met:- If two entities have common characters then one of them is fully contained inside another.- bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, and spoiler entities can contain and can be part of any other entities, except pre and code.- All other entities can't contain each other.
Links tg://user?id=<user_id> can be used to mention a user by their ID without using a username. Please note:

This is a legacy mode, retained for backward compatibility. To use this mode, pass Markdown in the parse_mode field. Use the following syntax in your message:

items.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

items.name: reply_markup
items.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

name: forwardMessage

items.description: Latitude of the location

items.name: longitude
items.description: Longitude of the location

items.name: horizontal_accuracy
items.description: The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

items.name: live_period
items.description: Period in seconds for which the location will be updated (see Live Locations, should be between 60 and 86400.

items.name: heading
items.description: For live locations, a direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.

items.name: proximity_alert_radius
items.description: For live locations, a maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.

items.name: disable_notification
items.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

items.name: protect_content
items.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

items.name: reply_to_message_id
items.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

items.name: allow_sending_without_reply
items.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

items.name: reply_markup
items.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

name: editMessageLiveLocation
description: Use this method to edit live location messages. A location can be edited until its live_period expires or editing is explicitly disabled by a call to stopMessageLiveLocation. On success, if the edited message is not an inline message, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.

items.name: chat_id
items.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

items.name: message_id
items.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

items.name: inline_message_id
items.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

items.name: latitude
items.description: Latitude of new location

items.name: longitude
items.description: Longitude of new location

items.name: horizontal_accuracy
items.description: The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

items.name: heading
items.description: Direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.

items.name: proximity_alert_radius
items.description: Maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.

items.name: reply_markup
items.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new inline keyboard.

name: stopMessageLiveLocation
description: Use this method to stop updating a live location message before live_period expires. On success, if the message is not an inline message, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.

items.name: chat_id
items.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

items.name: message_id
items.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message with live location to stop

items.name: inline_message_id
items.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

items.name: reply_markup
items.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new inline keyboard.

items.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

items.name: latitude
items.description: Latitude of the venue

items.name: longitude
items.description: Longitude of the venue

items.name: title
items.description: Name of the venue

items.name: address
items.description: Address of the venue

items.name: foursquare_id
items.description: Foursquare identifier of the venue

items.name: foursquare_type
items.description: Foursquare type of the venue, if known. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

items.name: google_place_id
items.description: Google Places identifier of the venue

items.name: google_place_type
items.description: Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)

items.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

items.name: allow_sending_without_reply

items.name: reply_markup

items.name: chat_id

items.name: phone_number
items.description: Contact's phone number

items.name: first_name
items.description: Contact's first name

items.name: last_name
items.description: Contact's last name

items.name: vcard
items.description: Additional data about the contact in the form of a vCard, 0-2048 bytes

items.name: disable_notification
items.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

items.name: protect_content

items.name: reply_to_message_id
items.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

items.name: allow_sending_without_reply
